This document is a definition of policy (See thread subject). Policy must be clear, as complete as possible and unambiguous.
Still not signing off.

S

Scott Teige PhD
Grid Operations Center Manager
Indiana University Research Technologies
steige@iu.edu<mailto:steige@iu.edu>
Office: +1 812 856 7331




On Nov 1, 2017, at 12:19 AM, Brian Bockelman <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote:

Hi,

This document is a discussion point for VOs to understand how the relationship with the OSG project works. I would be reluctant to require them to understand the internal structure of the OSG to figure out what we, as the entire project, are providing.

That said, I wouldn’t NACK a follow-on PR along the lines of what’s in the thread here. I didn’t see anything controversial in Scott’s original suggestion - can you just resubmit in PR form?

I don’t feel strongly - just let’s not get into the weeds.

Brian

Sent from my iPhone

> On Oct 31, 2017, at 11:36 AM, steige2 <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote:
>
> In the first bullet, OSG refers to entities that provide a stratum 1 service. Currently those entities are IU, BNL and FNAL. In the future there may be more. OSG, in general, could include UTA, for example. UTA has no responsibilities in bullet 1 so using OSG here generates an ambiguity.
>
> I did my best to resolve the ambiguities into what I think they mean in my comments of 11 days ago but it is entirely possible I'm wrong and that's why this needs to be unambiguously resolved. I suspect the real problem is we actually have different understandings of what "OSG" means in this context. Perhaps a phone call? I'll do my best to be available.
>
